page.title: 04The CLOCK TOWER.
page.content: THE CLOCK TOWER. Following a{night {raid}on{Coventry}by{German planes}a {Heinkel bomber jettisoned a land mine over{Kenilworth}on its way back to Germany.{Falling on}the area known as {"The Square"}it destroyed several fine old buildings and{knocked off the {"crown"}or top of the{Clock Tower,}a well-loved feature of the town which was erected in memory of an old Kenilworth family. The{Town Council had a copy of the original{"crown" made to{replace}the one destroyed in 1940. The work of{re-construction}was completed in{1963}and the{Clock Tower was finally{restored}to its former glory in the same year. The{new top}is easily{distinguishable}as its stone has a much newer,{cleaner}aspect than the{rest of the Tower}and{promotes many a{question}from{inquisitive {visitors}to the town.
